t: “At*pn that time Michael shall stand up, The*ld great prince who stands watch*i over the sons of your people; And*ld there shall be a time of trouble, Such*ld as never was since there was a nation, Even*ild to that time. And*ld at that time your people shall be delivered, Every*ld one who is found written in the book.
And*ld many of those who sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake, Some*ld to everlasting life, Some*ld to shame and*i everlasting contempt.
Those*ld who are wise shall shine Like*ld the brightness of the firmament, And*ld those who turn many to righteousness Like*ld the stars forever and ever.
“But*p you, Daniel, shut up the words, and seal the book until the time of the end; many shall run to and fro, and knowledge shall increase.”
Then*p I, Daniel, looked; and there stood two others, one on this riverbank and the other on that riverbank.
And one*i said to the man clothed in linen, who was*i above the waters of the river, “How long shall the fulfillment of these wonders be?”*i

Then*p I heard the man clothed in linen, who was*i above the waters of the river, when he held up his right hand and his left hand to heaven, and swore by Him who lives forever, that it*i shall*i be*i for a time, times, and half a*i time;*i and when the power of the holy people has been completely shattered, all these things*i shall be finished.
Although*p I heard, I did not understand. Then I said, “My lord, what shall*i be*i the end of these things?”*i
And*p he said, “Go your*i way,*i Daniel, for the words are*i closed up and sealed till the time of the end.
Many shall be purified, made white, and refined, but the wicked shall do wickedly; and none of the wicked shall understand, but the wise shall understand.
“And*p from the time that*i the daily sacrifice*i is taken away, and the abomination of desolation is set up, there*i shall*i be*i one thousand two hundred and ninety days.
Blessed is*i he who waits, and comes to the one thousand three hundred and thirty-five days.
“But*p you, go your*i way*i till the end; for you shall rest, and will arise to your inheritance at the end of the days.”
